Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater; inside glazed; outside, upper part of young hunter to right, petasos behind his head, two spears in lowered right hand; gesture of left hand uncertain, as are other traces to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 100 no. 346 pl. 74)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1019)
